website_summaries.verdict: A good price for a jack with aluminum components that keep it on the lightweight side, but it's not as easy to work with (or as reliable) as some competing models.
pros: A mid-priced jack that isn't too heavy thanks to steel and aluminum construction
Accommodates a wide range of lift heights
Saddle's rubber coating has rugged feel
cons: Challenging to assemble, and instructions aren't very helpful
Some lift failures after a few months have been reported
Known to occasionally leak hydraulic fluid

customer_reviews.title: 0 star if I could, No customer deserves a defective product
customer_reviews.text: 0 star if I could. I ordered one, but it was defective (the handle socket screw was stuck, couldn't turn into socket at all). I had to return it via ups (my back actually got hurt badly b/c it's heavy), and ordered another jack, hoping the second one would be better, Guess what? same problem again, which shows the first defect was not a random coincidence. No customer deserves a defective product, and no customer has obligation to go to ups for your fault......
customer_reviews.author: Qing Mu

customer_reviews.title: needs warranty, dangerous failure
customer_reviews.text: Was a good jack for less than a year, then one day as I was lifting my car to rotate tires, something inside gave way and the car dropped to the ground. Jack would not lift anymore. No warranty so you are on your own.
customer_reviews.author: Shauna

customer_reviews.title: Excellent jack
customer_reviews.text: Powerzone 380044 3 Ton jack. I have used this 3 ton jack quite a bit. I have used it under my 2012 Dodge Ram and my 2002 Mustang. I like that it is much lighter than all steel jacks. Of course always use jack stands before getting under any car and use on a stable surface. You do have to follow the instructions to get the air out of the hydraulics before using.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: One of the rear caster broke after less than 2 years of light use, cheep Chinese casters. Tried to contact Customer service to get a replacement caster, the phone number listed on the user manual rings and ask for an extension then hangs up. Tried contacting the email address listed in the owners manual, no response.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey D VanSkyhawk

customer_reviews.title: I would love to give this a review but I can't even ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good after the nightmare assembly that should have taken 2 seconds if Powerzone would have informed us about how to remove the bar used shipping. Update from my previous review and how to get the cable looking thing off the Yoke. Its actually not a cable it's just a coated metal bar and to remove it, just step on the Yoke and it should pop right off. Why Powerzone doesn't include this in the instructions or assembly I don't understand. Remeber it's just a little bar the has is bent on each end in a v or u shape used for shipping and won't come off by forcing it. Just step on the Yoke.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic jack - great value!
customer_reviews.text: I love this jack...it is very lightweight but very strong. I have a small garage and its low profile makes it easy to keep out of the way. For the price this thing is awesome, no complaints in the year that I've been using it. Highly recommend for its value, durability, strength, and convenience. I've had many friends and family members ask where I got this jack so they could get one of their own. Another thing to note - the dual pistons double the jacking efficacy with each pump of the handle, so you can pull the handle down just a hair to fine tune adjustments on height...something I absolutely love over other jacks I've had.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Powerzone floor jack
customer_reviews.text: This floor jack is very well built. I bought it to replace a 30yr old craftsman 2 ton floor jack. It cost more than I wanted to spend but I expect this will be the last jack I need in the garage for occasional jobs. Tip: Be careful when unpacking and removal of the keeper rod holding the handle receiver, it is shipped spring loaded with quite a force.
customer_reviews.author: Convoy

customer_reviews.title: This is really nice very heavy duty -- it can lift my truck ...
customer_reviews.text: This is really nice very heavy duty -- it can lift my truck and that's all that matters - been using it a lot - came just in time - breaks / water pump ... I like this so much - better than that tiny jack that comes with the truck and safer too easy to put together and take apart .. nice !
customer_reviews.author: wendy

customer_reviews.title: two years then fail
customer_reviews.text: Bought this from Amazon 10/28/2015. I have only used it occasionally. I expected this jack to be the last jack I ever bought. Stopped working in less than two years.
customer_reviews.author: baldeagle390

customer_reviews.title: Good and Versatile!
customer_reviews.text: Much better than my old craftsman floor jack. This is perfect for most cars as it works on my lowered BMW M3 and can also jack up my heavy BMW X5. The biggest difference between this and the Craftman lift is you can precisely release the load and lower the car. With the Craftsman, If I rotated the handle ever so slighlty, the car would drop quickly and I would have to turn the handle back to close the system. Very dangerous! This doesn't happen on this jack and I made sure both were purged of air.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Get more for your money.
customer_reviews.text: Well built, lots of lifting power. Bled out air, checked fluid and I've used it everyday for past two weeks. Year's of use to come if you do basic maintenance and use as intended. Lift it up, put on stands and do your work properly, but most of all SAFELY.
customer_reviews.author: sldmsen2

customer_reviews.title: Strong like bull.
customer_reviews.text: Best jack I've ever owned. Will even pick up my 4 door Jeep Wrangler. Easy to wheel around the garage, has a nice big rubber pad, the handle is the perfect length and the jack rises rapidly with each pump on said handle. This is low enough that it would easily fit under my Mini Cooper I used to own, yet it has enough travel to lift my lifted Jeep. I've owned a trolley jack before, it was junk. But I never knew, until I bought this diamond in the rough.
customer_reviews.author: Michael King

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Defective right out of the box. Followed instructions as the user's manual. The lift would not raise. Wasted an hour trying to assemble, only to find out that's it's a defective piece of trash.
customer_reviews.author: GGSM Mobile

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Junk just got it and it's pouring oil every time I pump it!!
customer_reviews.author: Lbrittain85

customer_reviews.title: ... the past 15 years and this one is the best I have had
customer_reviews.text: I have had 4 aluminum/steel jacks over the past 15 years and this one is the best I have had. I like to get the 3 ton so it doesn't struggle and can take a beating. Plus, sometimes I need that extra capacity for SUVs. Remember, for continuous use, you should look for something at least double the capacity of your typical job. This rule also works for torque wrenches.
customer_reviews.author: Tiki

customer_reviews.title: ... my husband for Christmas so far he is very happy with it he hasn't used it a lot so ...
customer_reviews.text: About this for my husband for Christmas so far he is very happy with it he hasn't used it a lot so if anything changes I will update my post if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Broken
customer_reviews.text: Jack worked great for just over a year. Something inside the pump must have broke causing one of the piston rods to not spring back. Jack is no better than scrap metal.
customer_reviews.author: Krystle

customer_reviews.title: Going strong since 2014
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 2014 and have used to to do oil changes, rotate tires, and general maintenance on 2 midsize cars and it is still going strong. The only thing I wish was better was the bolt for connecting the two halves of the handle since it kept falling out.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Used this jack maybe half a dozen times before it ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this jack maybe half a dozen times before it stopped lifting. Followed manufacturer's instructions for adding hydraulic fluid and purging without success.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S.

customer_reviews.title: Great jack.  Spring return handle is a little annoying.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome jack. I can finally lift my Corvette onto jack stands. BEWARE the powerful spring return mechanism on the pumping handle! I only use the half length handle because the long handle won't fit in my tight garage space. If you take your hand off the short handle the upward spring force is hazardous to your health. I've got a split lip to prove it. So, I give it 4 stars for not having the ability to disengage the spring return.
customer_reviews.author: R. Vernon

customer_reviews.title: Not quite heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Worked ok on a gmc sierra 1500, had maybe about 20 lifts until it gave out. No longer can lift anything. Buy something better quality if you are serious.
customer_reviews.author: S. K. Kam

customer_reviews.title: Numeral Uno Jack!
customer_reviews.text: Looks very well built and I believe it could lift any car or truck out there. I've always had a 2 ton or less and they are toys compared to this monster. One con is the black painted front wheels. Out of the box they left black marks on the garage floor. Took wheels off and added some grease. Don't seem to mark up the floor now but a press fitted bearing may be in the future and not sure about the black paint. I was very pleased how fast the lift raised up. I won't be cranking up the car jack all day except on the road. Now to tackle those wheel bearings, on the car.
customer_reviews.author: C. W. Randall

customer_reviews.title: Seals failed after 3 years of light use.
customer_reviews.text: The jack is big and clunky, worse part was it took a lot of pumps to raise my truck or even my car. After 3 years it's finally given up and started leaking fluid with each use.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Browning

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Leaking hydraulic fluid after only 4 months of light use.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Fasheh

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased with the performance of this jack
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with the performance of this jack. It is very well built. The handle can be used in full length for those heavy loads or it can be used in half length for those hard to reach areas. I really like the large "footprint" of the jack. It balances the load much more effectively and I feel more confident while jacking the load to its desired height before placing the safety stands. Very nice jack for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Snowfreak

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable and short life
customer_reviews.text: After 4 months of very irregular use, we started noticing a puddle of hydraulic oil under the unit. At this time, the jack is sitting in the corner of the shop and is destined for the scrap heap. It no longer extended to full height and our team is afraid to use it.
customer_reviews.author: HM

customer_reviews.title: And today it works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this jack for my 2010 Camaro a while back. And today it works like a charm. Even though the item is heavy, the shipping was fast. It took only a few minutes to assemble and get my car off the ground with no problem. But what goes up, must come down. Coming down will take some patience because you have to turn the handle very slowly. If you turn it too fast your vehicle will come down just as fast. I highly suggest you test the up/down functionality several times and get a feel for it before using it. I was glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: TheOracle1001

customer_reviews.title: Great jack for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Initially, it took a while to get there air out of the system. Actually had to go an buy some more fluid for the jack and fill it up as I worked the air out. However, since I did that it has been a great quality jack, especially for the price point. The overall construction of the jack is solid. With the partial aluminum and partial steel construction the jack is significantly lighter than other jacks of its size.
customer_reviews.author: Amos

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Jack
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this for about a year now and this jack has been phenomenal. I've used it to jack up my 2010 3/4 ton Duramax to just regular cars, even a lawn mower. It has worked flawlessly every time and I couldn't be happier with it!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: High quality jack for the price
customer_reviews.text: High quality jack for the price. I've been looking for the same 3 tons jack from Habor Freights for $89 with coupon but I did not trust it after reading many reviews from Pittsburg Tools. I got the powerzone today and I can tell it's high quality tool, raise up my SUV only took about 5 to 5 pumps which save me a lot of time comparing to my old 2 tons jack without rapid pumps. Amazon delivered it in two days and it's weighted around 60 lbs. I'm looking forward to use it for a long time with my car repair hobby.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought this as a present for my man. He ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a present for my man. He loves it, durable and no issues, we have had it for 3 months and has used it about 4 times with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Comes down fast.
customer_reviews.text: Releasing the jack, it's hard to find a nice spot where it comes down slow. It seems to have a very narrow range, that's hard to find, when you're letting the load down. Fairly heavy, if you want to be lifting it around. Had to wipe off the old grease where the handle fits in. There was some grit in it. Handle comes in two parts, with a screw that's meant to thread into the rather thin pipe. I'll be replacing that with a longer bolt and nut.
customer_reviews.author: notNylon!

customer_reviews.title: Waited for a Christmas special and so glad I got it
customer_reviews.text: I researched many hydraulic jacks and opted for this one. Waited for a Christmas special and so glad I got it. I only use it for two cars for oil changes and tire rotations for now; I've had for over six months and glad I did
customer_reviews.author: Xeneize07

customer_reviews.title: My man loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for Christmas, but he found the package outside before I did. I went ahead and let him have it and it's a good thing I did. He used this 2 days later to change oil on my car. I asked him if he liked it and he had an excited look in his eyes when he told me he loved it. He said it was a great heavy duty lift and it was very fluid in motion too. He happily showed me how easy it moved my car up and down. I know nothing about these things, but he was impressed.
customer_reviews.author: sheshe

customer_reviews.title: Because of that it liked to roll slightly during lifting and once up wasn't ...
customer_reviews.text: This performed flawlessly even though I used it on a somewhat un-level surface with a Sierra 1500. Because of that it liked to roll slightly during lifting and once up wasn't always firmly footed with all 4 wheels on the ground. It accomplished that without being destroyed or maiming me so I'd say it's well built of good materials. It arrived in a large box and much of the Styrofoam padding was made into a mess. It arrived unscathed though functional.
customer_reviews.author: impetusera

customer_reviews.title: Solidly Constructed but not built to last.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased it in 2011, but have only used it a dozen or so times. While lifting my truck to change some brakes it failed to hold position and would not get the truck off the ground. You could say I've had it for a long time, but I also haven't used it that frequently. In my case I don't think it warrants a good review.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: I love it, and love not having to work hard ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used this several times now, and have no regrets. I love it, and love not having to work hard raising my vehicles. I bought some hydraulic oil to top off the reservoir, which was only a hair low from the factory. No leaks thus far. The rubber insert is great for protecting whatever you're lifting, but I hope there are replacements to buy at some point, as I can see this wearing out over time.
customer_reviews.author: Joe L.

customer_reviews.title: Check Hydraulic Oil Level on Arrival
customer_reviews.text: Check the hydraulic oil level upon arrival (see instruction manual). Mine was significantly low on oil on arrival. It was not low enough to impair the operation of the jack. But, I just ordered some hydraulic oil so I can top it up (  ). Other than that, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Ski Bum

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: I owned a jack for over 15 years and it finally gave out, This piece of junk last just 3 years and was used less than 8 times and will no longer hold pressure! Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Good Jack for the Dollars Spent
customer_reviews.text: This jack replaced a OTC (Sears Label on it) Stinger from 1987. That old jack was a beast. I have had this jack for several month's now and am happy with it. I can maneuver it pretty easy and lifts with fewer strokes compared to the old unit. Time will tell how long it will last which these days is a gamble for anything you buy.
customer_reviews.author: Rail Bum

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This certainly isn't the best jack that I've used but this was absolutely great for it's price. I can tell this will last me many years until I can afford a garage with a full lift! (pipe dream..). One problem I had though, which could have ended very badly: The screw/pin holding the bar into the joint came loose. So, bar came out, pump went up, no way to bring the pump back down without the leverage from the bar. I had to use a large socket extension to activate the release and lower the car back onto the jack stands. Just be aware and make sure everything is TIGHT.
customer_reviews.author: Joe McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Very Useful
customer_reviews.text: Very useful tool when changing tires or doing brake jobs. Able to jack up my 6500lb Toyota Sequoia without any problem. Highly recommended. Makes my job easier.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Jack
customer_reviews.text: Awesome high quality jack.....just make sure you purge it when you first get it and also fill up the hydraulic fluid reservoir !!! After that you got yourself a great jack. Was able to lift my mustang's whole front-end fast and easily. Very impressed....great deal !!!
customer_reviews.author: David hicks

customer_reviews.title: Buy something better!
customer_reviews.text: Jack worked on 3 cars and now it won't even go up at all! Less than 24 hours old
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: This jack is all that I could possibly ask for. It can support 3 tons and is very sturdy. I never have to worry about whether or not it will work. I have had the jack for about 5 months now and have used it a handful of times on my car. I have never once been disappointed, in fact it seems like every time I use it, I can't believe how effortlessly I can lift my vehicle. The one drawback is that it is very heavy, weighing about 62 pounds. But if you can lift the jack than all that means is that you have a more sturdy piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Kuhn

customer_reviews.title: Finally have an excellent and powerful jack.
customer_reviews.text: Before I got this I tried a 2 ton Aluminum jack. it was lightweight but not enough power. This jack is a little on the heavy side but is also very powerful. The one thing I really like is the fact that the when in use the handle stays down. On the small one and some others I have used the handle would want to go up against the side of the vehicle. The handle is in two pieces with a bolt to hold them together but will easily separate when in storage.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I can tell by looking at this that it and lifting it up (luckily I could lift some heavy weights). It's very durable, construction is A- which is great. Wheels didn't swivel smoothly perhaps part of is because the ground wasn't smooth. It took a good 5-7 good pumps to get the car up at the height I wanted it to be. I was impressed at how quickly it raised my car up. It also was very easy to control to lower the car and how smoothly it goes down. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: J. Au

customer_reviews.title: Super great jack, thankful bought it at $150!!
customer_reviews.text: Very light, strong and quick pump! Works great for switching winter and summer rims, here in Alaska. Thank you seller! P.s. long time after purchase until I did my review.
customer_reviews.author: Max Power

customer_reviews.title: Failed after a few uses
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking jack. Worked great at first. After 6-8 uses over a few years, it will no longer lift any weight. Checked everything, unable to fix it. Spend a little extra and get a good name brand. Not recommended!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brian M. Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after just 2 years.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for two years then just as quickly stopped working. Never leaked any fluid or anything, nothing on the exterior is broken, but it simply won't jack up. Acts as if the handle is turned all the way left (valve open) but it is definitely tightened up to the right. Nothing stripped so I am assuming the problem is internal. So while it lasted it was a great and sturdy little jack, but the fact it randomly stopped working one day after just 2 years of light-moderate use is a bit of a bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Badger

customer_reviews.title: Great jack.
customer_reviews.text: Great jack.. will lift whole front of my 4x4 Ram with a Cummins. Only issue is that it does not have a fast pump action to bring pad to axle in a single stroke of the jack handle. Otherwise, pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Shane S

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Do yourself a favor and spend the extra money for this. Compared to the "el cheapo's" this product is worth every dime. It isnt a "use twice and then have to throw away" item. It has a lot of value for the money and pays for itself with one tire rotation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: its shiny
customer_reviews.text: Hey it lifted my 06 mdx. I haven't put it to a real test yet. This thing is heavy tho. I dropped it on first use after standing it up trying to take a hook out the neck that holds the collar down to store in box. Well its under tension and once I released, the neck went one way, the hook went the other way and In the melee I just let go. Hit the garage floor on its little wheels. No damage tho. Did I mention its heavy
customer_reviews.author: ramz

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous I own two
customer_reviews.text: I have two now and both have performed flawlessly. They have been a real life saver. light weight and half the price of the ones from the big box stores that charge 350.00 for theirs. These work with no problems. Follow the directions to bleed them before use and I have had no problems with them in the cold weather of winter or in the heat of the summer. They don't slow leak either. But do use safety Jacks under them. Never trust a floor jack EVER!! It's your life.
customer_reviews.author: tml9170

customer_reviews.title: Where is the customer service for this thing?
customer_reviews.text: Bought it on April 5, 2013. Very good first impression and good performance for months but i see quick lift pump starts leaking. Now I realize that there is no way to contact the seller or manufacturer and get the faulty part.
customer_reviews.author: Lila McGuire

customer_reviews.title: So far, So good
customer_reviews.text: Did not have much chance to use this last year, but when I did I liked what I saw. I had no problems whatsoever and am glad I bought this item. It is much lighter than an all steel jack, which is a huge plus for me. I do not use it much, so I can not attest to its ability to withstand heavy use. It was well packages and arrived in perfect condition. I will update this review in the fall of 2013 after I have it for one year. So far, my opinion is that you can not go wrong with this item.
customer_reviews.author: JenniferNY

customer_reviews.title: I finally have a floor jack
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift, and I love it. No longer do I have to get out the scissor jack they put in vehicles to change the spare tire! It lifts pretty high, and it's decently light for a 3 ton jack. Looks awesome in the shop and does the job fluidly. Just be careful when removing retaining clip on the lifting mechanism...I thought I broke my fingers when it snapped them in the springs.
customer_reviews.author: Shan

customer_reviews.title: Built Like a Tank
customer_reviews.text: Overall a great jack, there are plenty other models that are lighter to move around but if you stay in your garage it has wheels to nullify that problem. I feel better knowing the jack feels like a tank when jacking up the car compared to some of these light weight all aluminum jacks that feel like they are going to snap under any load. No jack is safe people, buy JACK STANDS with this purchase...
customer_reviews.author: G00seEggs

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and use
customer_reviews.text: This is the first garage jack I've ever bought or used myself. Assembling it was very straight forward; all I had to do was unscrew a locking pin, insert the 'arm' and screw it back in. Jack worked easily and as expected when I replaced all four winter tire/wheels. I had no problem sliding it under the mount points of my somewhat low-to-the-ground sedan. Price was great compared to other similar jacks. I would highly recommend this item!
customer_reviews.author: Irwin Tsay

customer_reviews.title: great floor jack
customer_reviews.text: I love it. Greatly saved my time to jack up my vehicle for maintenance and repair work. It takes some getting use to, but one you get the hang of it, it is really easy to control the lowering of your vehicle with the turning of the bar. Using a smart combination of aluminum and steel, the jack is lighter weight, yet feels rock solid. I have high confidence using it on my Honda Pilot SUV. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard

customer_reviews.title: May be aluminum, but it is still heavy duty.
customer_reviews.text: Don't let the aluminum fool you. This jack is every bit heavy duty as my old Arcan, all steel jack. If you are going to be lifting heavy vehicles, I wouldn't trust a feather weight jack anyway so for a home jack, weight is of no concern for me. Lifting action is smooth, the handle comes with a bumper pad which I did not expect, construction is great for a jack in this price range. Bottom line, this is a great home jack for the price.
customer_reviews.author: 69z28turbo

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: Used it to lift my truck to put on Jack stands and ramps when I it was vroke. Family came in town had flat on rental car. Had Lil small Jack I came with this one like 6 pumps it was up. Only problem is wish the wheels could lock or something. Got to be carefully the jack will roll under vehicle if not careful
customer_reviews.author: MRFAMU03

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a great jack that is heavy duty. I had a mechanic in my shop that was envious.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, tough, handle wont stay on
customer_reviews.text: The jack itself works quite well. It is light enough to easily move around with one hand while under the vehicle. I use this for lifting my GMC Duramax, and it does the job easily! The handle is difficult to depress when lifting the truck, but that is to be expected with such a load! The jack handle will not stay attached to the lever body of the jack, as the retaining set-screw seems poorly made/designed. Aside from this, it is a great floor jack and I'd gladly recommend it to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Hessian19

customer_reviews.title: This is my favorite Amazon purchase yet!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best money I've spent on autotive tools ever. This service jack is fantastic. After years of working with cheapo smaller sized jacks that can barely life the car 10" I decided to do an upgrade to this one. Best purchase I've made in a while and it's worth every penny. Smooth lifting, great lift height, very solid build and its light enough for easy maneuverability. I did lots of research before I bought this one but the rest of the reviews helped and I'm extremely happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MD Rider

customer_reviews.title: Extremely reliable
customer_reviews.text: I trust this thing with my life. I love it so much I wish I had two so they could keep each other company. I've had it for 4 months and I use it almost every other day or so, but one thing I noticed, the rubber in the circle took a good bite all the way down to the metal underneath, and I realize with the wear and tear on it I may only have a jack pad for a limited time before I have to use a block of wood between it and the car. this problem is nothing. also it's very heavy but I don't really wanna downgrade, but I do, but I dont
customer_reviews.author: Braden L. Young

customer_reviews.title: Not the cheapest, but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Seems sturdy and well made, I like the large, rubber covered contact point. On the one hand, I don't care for the long handle, on the other hand, I like that you can leave it on the jack, and just leave the jack in a corner of the garage because the handle stays at a 90 degree angle.
customer_reviews.author: drh3b

customer_reviews.title: What a piece of junk...
customer_reviews.text: The handle won't even stay in and the entire thing just feels like a piece of junk
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Good Jack!
customer_reviews.text: Jack works perfectly. Bought this jack because the specs matched my needs. The lift height is sufficient for the jack stands that I have and has more than enough lifting power. The 58 lbs. weight of this product is still pretty heavy to lift and carry, but is still lighter than many other jacks with comparable specs. The jack rolls easily across my garage floor which is asphalt. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: happydays

customer_reviews.title: Floor jack
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty. Well made. Good action and strong springs. Gives me the confidence to lift and work under (with jack stands, of course) my 4000lb. car.
customer_reviews.author: PTaylor

customer_reviews.title: Great jack for what i needed it for
customer_reviews.text: Use it to do a oil change on two different cars. Works great. Just pulled out the metal holding it in place for what I think was for shipment and followed the sets on the paper to let out the air and went to work that same min I got it on the first oil changed then did one two days later no problems at all. Picked up the car with out a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Zeke G.

customer_reviews.title: One year
customer_reviews.text: Failed violently after one year. Got some injuries as a result.
customer_reviews.author: UMWGuy

customer_reviews.title: Just awesome.
customer_reviews.text: I've got a small luxury car and a Japanese mini van. i changed rotated the tires on both vehicles using this Jack nd it was just like butter. The box arrived completely intact. It assembled fast (really just the handle). After four minutes of unpacking and two minutes of assembly, I was in the garage, setting the chocks and jacking up the mini van. The handle is very responsive and the jack lowered excellently according to the speed I indicated with the degree of twist to the left. This is a great jack!
customer_reviews.author: Bedreaded

customer_reviews.title: Finally a good Jack!
customer_reviews.text: This Jack works great..! Lifts my F350 easily. I really like the half Aluminum/half steel build.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: A dependable floor jack
customer_reviews.text: Ive been using this for a several years now & quite frequent. I've had no complaints. Have recommended to others & glad to have come across this one, thanks
customer_reviews.author: billy benton

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but test it out.
customer_reviews.text: Bought one years ago for my father and no issues. just got my own and i don't think the jack is staying up. need to let it sit overnight and see, but think its settling which isn't good.
customer_reviews.author: amazon2309234

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: This was definitely a price point purchase - for the money this jack seems hard to beat. Was concerned about it being made in China, but the quality appears to be good. I've only used it once (to install a skid plate on a jeep), I'll have to see how it holds up over time. For the average do it yourselfer, this seems to be a hard jack beat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: i love that it's fairly light weight and can still lift ...
customer_reviews.text: i've had the jack for a while and used it quite a bit without any issues so far. i love that it's fairly light weight and can still lift up my full sized truck easily. it's also small enough to fit under my 350z which is pretty close to the ground. the instructions to purge the air was pretty easy as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Bassist

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Other than the box having a hole where the jack handle receiver is when it arrived, this was a great purchase. I have used it multiple times and it works very well. I have used this to raise my Dodge pick up and on the opposite spectrum my VW CC and VW GTI. It is low enough to get under both cars, but powerful and tall enough to work on my truck as well.
customer_reviews.author: B. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work well and do what it was intended to do. I have seen others that are cheaper but have not tried them so I can not compare. If I had to do it over again I would probably attempt a cheaper one because the price seemed a little to high when there are other options available with good reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Craigg

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty heavy and safe to jack up the car so ...
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty heavy and safe to jack up the car so that I can do my jobs well under the car
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Woo

customer_reviews.title: Scored big points with husband on this
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband, as he does most of our auto maintenance. I don't think I've ever seen him so excited about anything. He jacked up my F-150 is 10 seconds and finished the brake job in record time. He was like a kid at Christmas. Five stars just for the unending smile on his face. Oh - and he says it works great~
customer_reviews.author: Laura C.

customer_reviews.title: It's Okay
customer_reviews.text: This jack has a rubber pad on the lifting area. My earlier jacks had a cup-like thing. I had a adapter that fit the cup that protected the pinch weld where I lift the car. The adapter kinda words but doesn't well with the rubber pad. It's nice that it's lighter but there still must be a lot of steel because it isn't as much lighter as I expected.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: BaddaBing!
customer_reviews.text: Best bang for the buck. If you are looking for something mobile, go with HF's cheap aluminum one as this one is beast mode! Nothing better out there in comparison to this one.
customer_reviews.author: MountainOp

customer_reviews.title: Nice jack but rusting
customer_reviews.text: Nice jack but the wheels and bolts are rusting after only a few months.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: after using for about 1 year, it still works very good- no signs of leaking, easy to use. The only problem I had was the rubber disc on top of the lister has been torn.
customer_reviews.author: GJL

customer_reviews.title: great addition to my garage
customer_reviews.text: 1,000,000 times better than the ones you get with the jack/stand sets....I absolutely love that it can jack the car up in about 6 pumps...probably don't even need a stand if leaving up (but better not to risk it)....being able to lower just by twisting is awesome, as is being able to make the handle half length....can be stored with the handle upright, so no need to dismantle....worth it!
customer_reviews.author: asdf

customer_reviews.title: Very nice jack - pumps and raises easily - lighter than ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice jack - pumps and raises easily - lighter than expected - quality better than expected - love the nice, smooth, let down of the jack - moves easily Compared to the Torin Big Red jack... (it was new) failed 3 ton jack I just returned to the store.....this jack is miles and miles ahead of it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bucs Anthem

customer_reviews.title: Solid jack stand with good height and quick lift.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to get ready for use. Lifts my SUV with relative ease and gets me the height I need with room to spare. The lift is pretty quick, not three pumps, but pretty good. Should have purchased this years ago to replace my tiny jackstand in a plastic case.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad I bought it before the price went up
customer_reviews.text: A whole lot lighter and faster than my old floor jack, I'm glad I bought it before the price went up.
customer_reviews.author: JRK

customer_reviews.title: ... it to work on my 4runner and it works great. Also low enough to fit under my wife's ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to work on my 4runner and it works great. Also low enough to fit under my wife's Sienna van. Have only used it about 4 times but it seems to be quality quite well. Postman must hate me because he's old and this thing weighs about fifty pounds. Metal all around and it lifts quick. My friend wants to get one now.
customer_reviews.author: YoboDiver

customer_reviews.title: Just worked on my car a bunch, and this ...
customer_reviews.text: Just worked on my car a bunch, and this worked really well for getting it up on some stands. For reference, I was working on a 2009 Subaru Legacy.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Northrup

customer_reviews.title: tough
customer_reviews.text: very strong an capable light an tough brother allways wans to use it!
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne Schwindt

customer_reviews.title: Checked the jack over upon arrival everything looked good and as pictured on Amazom
customer_reviews.text: Checked the jack over upon arrival everything looked good and as pictured on Amazom. Bled the jack per instructions and used it during a brake job, raised the car with no problem. Took 8 pumps to raise the car, since this isn't a speed jack it was normal. Had a slight twist when fully raised due to driveway having a slight slope to it but since some parts are steel the jack handled it easily. The jack just plain works and looks very good as a bonus and for the price was a much better deal for me than paying $250 for an all aluminum jack. Good deal.
customer_reviews.author: ex-bluecollarguy

customer_reviews.title: So far it works as it's supposed to. It's ...
customer_reviews.text: So far it works as it's supposed to. It's very well made with a slightly rough finish. The only drawback that I've noticed is that it is very hard to slowly lower the jack. It takes only a few degrees of twist to go from the locked position to dropped position. There's almost no in-between. It serves my purposes though.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck K

customer_reviews.title: Hard to slowly lower jack
customer_reviews.text: Best jack for the money but - echoing what another reviewer said: "The only drawback that I've noticed is that it is very hard to slowly lower the jack. It takes only a few degrees of twist to go from the locked position to dropped position. There's almost no in-between." This is a problem for me.
customer_reviews.author: Learning2

customer_reviews.title: Good quality paid for itself in two oil changes!
customer_reviews.text: I am a DIY guy used the jack a few times paid for itself did a tire change when my wife ran over a nail in a brand new tire of course. For two oil changes and tire rotations. Not really lightweight but very durable and easy to use! Better than most full steel jacks I saw at big box retail stores. Quality is really good more than I need being a DIY guy.
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: This is way better than having to crawl under my trailer to use ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this jack for my 5th wheel RV. This is way better than having to crawl under my trailer to use a bottle jack. I can use this 6000 pound jack to pick up just one axle when I have a flat. These aluminum jacks work great and are lighter than the steel ones.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Guidry

customer_reviews.title: Rugged and Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty happy with this jack. It has a good grip, and is well made. Looking forward to years of use.
customer_reviews.author: John Berk

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: It has been used sparingly, so long term quality is hard to determine. Initial quality seems fair for the price, and if it holds up, a great jack for occasional use in a home garage. I did notice it weeping oil almost immediately. That was disappointing, even though the performance seems unaffected. 4 stars for a jack that isn't completely leak proof.
customer_reviews.author: Eccomi

product_meta.title: Powerzone 380044 3 Ton Aluminum and Steel Garage Jack
product_meta.description: The Powerzone Heavy Duty Steel and Aluminum Garage Jack lifts from 4 inch to 18-1/4 inch and supports 3 tons. The jack has a lightweight aluminum frame and heavy duty steel lift arm for strength and durability. The quick lifting hydraulic system saves time and is equipped with safety valve to prevent overloading beyond rated capacity. The jack is equipped with a rubber padded saddle and a foam covered handle to protect vehicle frame. Real wheels swivel for easy movement and positioning over rough surfaces.
feature_bullets: Rated capacity: 3 Ton (6000 pounds) with lift range 4 inch to 18-1/4 inch
Jack is made of light weight aluminum frame to reduce product weight and increase portability, and is equipped with heavy duty steel lift arm for strength and durability
Quick lifting hydraulic system saves time and is equipped with safety valve to prevent overloading beyond rated capacity
Rubber padded saddle protects vehicle frame
Rear wheels swivel for easy positioning

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars893 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
